result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary Dennis Matz

records.addlTxt:
3:41 PM Defendant Gary Dennis Matz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana appeared by video for Gary Dennis Matz.  Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Court sets ARGN.  Atty Hayes notes DE failed to appear due to transportation issues and also didn't have a working phone.  Address is correct.  State agrees to reinstating the previous bond.  Atty Hayes doesn't object.  Court orders previous bond be reinstated along w/it's conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:12 PM Defendant Gary Dennis Matz not in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Gary Dennis Matz.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Delain in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Masana has no record to make regarding DE's non-appearance.  State requests a warrant.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.

10:22 AM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gary Dennis Matz in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Gary Dennis Matz.  Court states case and appearances.  State calls Officer Kyle Mueller - SCSD - S&T.  Witness ID's DE.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Masana does cross-exam.  Witness excused.  No further witnesses.  State makes argument.  Atty Masana has no argument.  Court finds probable cause/binds DE over for trial.  Atty Masana requests ARGN be set out but does acknowledge that they rec'd a hard copy of the information in court today.  Court advises parties to be ready to enter a plea at the ARGN date.  

Arraignment scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:10 PM Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell and intern Dan Moon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gary Dennis Matz in court.  DE was turned down for atty. at PD's office and Court.  Court reviews financial information.  Court finds conditionally indigent.   Court appoints Attorney Peter Masana @$100/hr and reimbursement @ $25.00/month commencing  8/1/22.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 18, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 22, 2022 at 11:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Gary Dennis Matz
Current: 218 W. Division St., Mazomanie, WI 53560 United States  (Effective: 04-21-2022)
Prior: E11868 Dam Heights Rd, Prairie Du Sac, WI 53578

2:08 PM Defendant Gary Dennis Matz in court.  Court reviews financial information.  Court cannot find DE indigent due to equity in home and declines to appointment an attorney.  DE advised rights to an attorney.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Indigency hearing on May 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
No contact w/J.R.B., residence or employment. May retrieve your belongings if accompanied by a law enforcement officer upon prior notice, one time.

Pre-trial conference on May 20, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Return date on June 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

03:15 PM Defendant Gary Dennis Matz in court, in custody w/atty. Dolch.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  DE needs to apply with PD's office for representation.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $1000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact w/J.R.B., residence or employment.  May retrieve your belongings if accompanied by a law enforcement officer upon prior notice, one time.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 11:15 am.  Return date scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
